definition: Franz Kafka (1883-1924), Czech Jewish writer

sentences.english: I mean that the significance of the novel is more particular and more personal to Kafka.
sentences.chinese: 我指的是，對卡夫卡來說，這本小說別具深意。

sentences.english: Morning. I need that Kafka's Motorbike release by 11:00.
sentences.chinese: 早，“卡夫卡摩托車”要在十一點發布新書促銷新聞。

sentences.english: He is also regarded as "the Father of Fantastic Literature" in modernist literature.
sentences.chinese: 在現代主義文學中，卡夫卡被稱爲“荒誕文學之父”。

sentences.english: This is exactly the Kafkaesque world that the pro-democracy protesters were trying to abolish.
sentences.chinese: 這恰恰是卡夫卡世界裏的企圖廢除民主抗議者。

sentences.english: They don't try to understand Kafka or Finnegans Wake.
sentences.chinese: 他們並不試圖理解卡夫卡或者《芬內根守靈》。

sentences.english: Kafkaesque is a famous contemporary novelist of Austria and one of the originators of modernist school of literature.
sentences.chinese: 卡夫卡是奧地利現代著名小說家，現代派文學的鼻祖。

sentences.english: Kafka's novels opened up a yawning "frontier to implausibility".
sentences.chinese: 卡夫卡的小說則打開了一個無限擴張的非理性世界。

sentences.english: There are many versions of the story of Kafka and the doll.
sentences.chinese: 卡夫卡和洋娃娃的故事，有許多版本。

sentences.english: Here again Kafka's thought runs parallel to Kierkegaard.
sentences.chinese: 卡夫卡的思想於是再次與克爾凱郭爾的交匯到了一起。

sentences.english: It seems that this naturalness is Kafka's.
sentences.chinese: 似乎，這種自然性是卡夫卡式的。

sentences.english: In Kafka's story, a person metamorphoses into a bug.
sentences.chinese: 在卡夫卡的小說中，一個人變形成了一條小蟲。

sentences.english: The characteristics of kafkaesque s personality mechanism was fear and self-abasement.
sentences.chinese: 恐懼和自卑是卡夫卡人格機制的主要特徵。

sentences.english: I write more about my spiritual experiences, like Kafka.
sentences.chinese: 我更多的是寫我的精神體驗，就像卡夫卡一樣。

sentences.english: Such comics tend to portray a noirish and Kafkaesque version of the modern world.
sentences.chinese: 這些漫畫都有意描繪一個帶有卡夫卡色彩的現代世界。

definition: Fyodor Mikhailovich Dostoevsky (1821-1881), great Russian novelist, author of Crime and Punishment 罪與罰|罪与罚[Zui4 yu3 Fa2]
pinyin: Tuo2 si1 tuo3 ye1 fu1 si1 ji1

definition: William Faulkner (1897-1962), American novelist and poet
Jorge Luis Borges
Marcel Proust (1871-1922), French author
Ulysses (novel)
Gustave Flaubert (1821-1880), French realist novelist, author of Madame Bovary
Honoré de Balzac (1799-1850), French novelist, author of series La comédie humaine
Jean-Paul Sartre (1905-1980), French existential philosopher and novelist
Orwell (name)/George Orwell (1903-1950), British novelist, author of Animal Farm 動物農場|动物农场 and 1984 一九八四年
Maugham (family name)/W. Somerset Maugham (1874-1965), English writer
Stendhal
Alexandre Dumas, père (1802-1870), French writer
Tolstoy (name)/Count Lev Nikolayevich Tostoy (1828-1910), great Russian novelist, author of War and Peace 戰爭與和平|战争与和平
Anton Pavlovich Chekhov (1860-1904), Russian writer famous for his short stories and plays
James Joyce (1882-1941), Irish modernist writer, author of Ulysses and Finnegans Wake
pinyin: Zhan1 mu3 si1 · Qiao2 yi1 si1

definition: Hugo (name)/Victor Hugo (1802-1885), French writer
